unit_learning_outcomes.description: Design evidence based learning experiences that foster safe and supportive classroom environments.
Evaluate the implications of professional ethics and responsibilities and the legislative, administrative and organisational requirements of teachers' work.
Examine the range of relationships between students, teachers, family and school and ways to communicate, be responsive and build productive links.
Reflect on the research-based pedagogies and knowledge that inform innovation and future directions in educational policy and practice.
Critically reflect on teaching experiences and research and demonstrate understanding of best practice teaching.
Identify the factors that impact professional learning, professional life phases and teacher resilience.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Reading and reflexive responses to required and recommended readings
Completion of regular tasks and forums

assessments.description: 10 min. Viva voce or oral/multi-modal reflection on an issue of educational significance and that reflects on areas such as: the distinctive features of a particular teaching subject, role and responsibilities of a teacher and issues relating to the transition to the teaching profession.

assessments.assessment_title: Teachers’ work, student learning and future issues in education in Australia
assessments.description: 2500 words. An extended response that offers a research informed personal perspective on teachers’ work, student learning and future issues in education in Australia.

data.subject_search_title: EDST4180 - Transitioning to the Secondary Teaching Profession
data.description: The unit focusses on the issues and processes of the transition to teaching. The unit explores the nature of teachers' worlds and work including: teacher identity, professional life phases, strategies for resilience and the impact of school culture, professional learning and education policy on teachers' practice. The unit allows students to reflect on ways to develop responsive relationships with parents and school communities and on the significance of research-based practice in leading innovation and transforming schools for the future.
